newsitem.title: GERMANY: Thyssen up on report of strong share potential.
newsitem.headline: Thyssen up on report of strong share potential.

text.p: Shares in German engineering group Thyssen AG advanced strongly in pre-bourse trade on reports it was planning to tell shareholders its shares have the potential to reach a price of around 550 marks.

The report in the Handelsblatt newspaper that the share price could rise to well above current levels, and above the 435 marks Krupp-Hoesch offered in a takeover bid last week, drove the share to 402 marks, up 11.50 marks or 2.94 percent.
The overall market was up 23.63 points, or 0.72 percent, at 3,312.15 points.
After Krupp-Hoesch announced its offer last week, Thyssen agreed to discuss a joint steel company. If the talks fail, Krupp said it planned to reinstate its offer.
